sentences.english: Western officials seem glumly reconciled to another term for Mr Karzai.
sentences.chinese: 西方官員似乎對卡爾扎伊的連任感到悶悶不樂。

sentences.english: You must rid yourself of this gloomy mood.
sentences.chinese: 你必須使自己擺脫這種悶悶不樂的憂鬱情緒。

sentences.english: M enters the room and sees that BYJ sitting on a sofa and looks worried.
sentences.chinese: 走進房間看到勇俊坐在沙發上悶悶不樂。

sentences.english: Get on with life and don't sit back and mope .
sentences.chinese: 活躍一些享受生活，不要閒待著悶悶不樂的。

sentences.english: He moped in the house all day.
sentences.chinese: 他整天悶悶不樂地呆在屋裏。

sentences.english: You are day and night oppressed with the sting of iniquity for the crimes and wanton cruelties you have committed.
sentences.chinese: 您整日悶悶不樂是因爲您慘無人道，作惡多端。

sentences.english: Often this leads us to spend hours moping and falling in to depression.
sentences.chinese: 這會導致我們很長時間悶悶不樂或情緒沮傷。

sentences.english: He was hipped for losing his purse.
sentences.chinese: 他因丟了錢包而悶悶不樂。

sentences.english: Poor John has been moping the whole week away, I'm getting quite worried about him.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的約翰整個星期都悶悶不樂，我真十分替他擔心。
“哦，”她悶悶不樂地說，“是你們兩個。”

sentences.english: Stop moping and start making your own motivation.
sentences.chinese: 別悶悶不樂了，馬上給自己找一些動力。

sentences.english: Every time I saw or talked to Mother I was heartsick.
sentences.chinese: 每次看到母親或者與母親聊天，我都悶悶不樂。
他看上去有點悶悶不樂的樣子。

sentences.english: A fit of the sullen got short shrift in our house.
sentences.chinese: 在我們家裏，悶悶不樂是不會有人搭理你的。

sentences.english: If I take the away or it breaks, he is unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 如果我拿走甜餅或者是小甜餅碎了，他就悶悶不樂。

definition: not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
to worry/to be on one's mind
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
